JUDGES: Javier Borrego Borrego;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Snejana Botoucharova
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr Z. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the Minister of Industry quashed ab initio a decree of CARDINAL DATE by which the factory owned by the applicant ’s parents had been nationalised . The applicant and his sister recovered the property in DATE . The factory was in a very poor state . As the former occupants refused to make repairs , the applicant and his sister brought proceedings for damages on DATE .
By an interim judgment of DATE , the GPE ORG ( obvodní soud ) decided that the claim of the applicant and his sister was , in respect of the first defendant , well founded .
On DATE ORG adopted a supplementary judgment by which it dismissed the applicant ’s and his sister ’s action in respect of the second defendant .
On DATE the applicant and his sister filed an appeal against the CARDINAL judgments .
On DATE ORG quashed the judgments and sent the case to ORG .
On DATE the applicant informed the court that his sister had died . He proposed to suspend the proceedings on his late sister ’s claim while the court continued to deal with his claim .
On DATE ORG decided to suspend the proceedings until the termination of the inheritance proceedings . The applicant appealed against this decision .
It seems that the proceedings are still pending .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
